page.title: 09FARMING IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: SOIL TYPES in the Godmersham area are clay and flints, loam and chalk,gravel, and loam,chalk and gravel. CROPS grown are:- Oil seed rape, winter oats, spring barley, winter barley, winter wheat and a small acreage of strawberries. Woodland covers a large acreage and also rough grazing land unsuitable for cultivation. Grassland is mainly permanent pasture with a small acreage used for hay and sileage. Hops were grown until 1940. Problems are flooding in the valley and damage from deer, pigeons and rabbits. ANIMALS almost 1000 sheep graze the pastures, Kent ewes for breeding and Scotch Mule Tegs, plus a few Jacobs for their fleeces. A few Freisian Heifers are reared on contract.
